text: The 1920 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1920 college football season. Head coach Gus Welch led the team to a 1–1 mark in the PCC and 5–1 overall. This year marked the team's adoption of the "Cougars" nickname. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | October 9 | Gonzaga | Away | 35-0 W | 3,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 15 | Idaho | Away | 14-7 W | 5,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 30 | Montana | Home | 31-0 W | 5,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 6 | California | Away | 0-49 L | 20,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 13 | Oregon State | Home | 28-0 W | 3,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 25 | Nebraska | Away | 21-20 W | 10,000 |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1920 in Washington (state)
